MethodsÂ¶

Histfactory.__init__(workspace_folder=None, name=None, regions_folders_base_name='Region', bkg_files_base_name='BkgOnly', patch_files_base_name='patch', output_folder=None, input_file=None, verbose=True)[source]Â¶

The Histfactory object can be initialized in two different ways, depending on the value of the input_file argument.

  • input_file is None (default)

    All arguments are parsed and saved in corresponding attributes. If name is None (default), then a name is created and saved in the corresponding attribute. The private method Histfactory.__import is called to import the workspace specified by the argument workspace_folder. Finally, the Histfactory.save method is called to save the object. See the documentation of the aforementioned methods for more details.

  • input_file is not None

    The object is reconstructed from the input files through the private method Histfactory.__load Depending on the value of the argument output_folder the Histfactory.__init__ method behaves as follows:

    • If output_folder is None (default) or is equal to input_folder

      The attribute Histfactory.output_folder is set equal to the Histfactory.input_folder one.

    • If output_folder is not None and is different than input_folder

      The new output_folder is saved in the Histfactory.output_folder attribute and files present in the input folder are copied to the new output folder, so that all previous results are preserved in the new path.

  • Arguments

    See class Arguments documentation.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Histfactory.output_h5_file (only if input_file is None)

    • Histfactory.output_json_file (only if input_file is None)

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory._Histfactory__check_define_input_files(verbose=None)Â¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to input files and folders

  • Histfactory.input_file

  • Histfactory.input_folder

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

depending on the initial value of the Histfactory.input_file attribute.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      See verbose.

Histfactory._Histfactory__check_define_name()Â¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to define the Histfactory.name attribute. If the latter attribute is None, then it is replaced with "model_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_histfactory", otherwise the suffix â_histfactoryâ is appended (preventing duplication if it is already present).

Histfactory._Histfactory__check_define_output_files(timestamp=None, verbose=False)Â¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to output files and folders

  • Histfactory.output_folder

  • Histfactory.output_h5_file

  • Histfactory.output_json_file

  • Histfactory.output_log_file

depending on the initial values of the Histfactory.input_folder and Histfactory.output_folder attributes. It also creates the output folder if it does not exist.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      See verbose.

Histfactory._Histfactory__import(verbose=None)Â¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to import an histfactory workspace. The method scans through the regions folders in the Histfactory.workspace_folder, determines all background and signal (patch) files and generates the dictionary attribute Histfactory.likelihoods_dict. Upon creation, all items in this dictionary, corresponding to all available likelihoods, have the flag load_model = False.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      See verbose.

Histfactory._Histfactory__load(verbose=None)Â¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to load a previously saved Histfactory object from the files

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

The method loads, with the deepdish package, the content od the Histfactory.input_h5_file file into a temporary dictionary, subsequently used to update the Histfactory.__dict__ attribute. The method also loads the content of the Histfactory.input_log_file file, assigning it to the Histfactory.log attribute.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      See verbose.

Histfactory.get_likelihood_object(lik_number=None, output_folder=None, verbose=None)[source]Â¶

Generates a Lik object (see its documentation for details) containing all properties needed for further processing. If the lik_number argument corresponds to a likelihood that has not jet been imported with the Histfactory.import_likelihoods method, then this method is called and the likelihood is automatically imported.

  • Arguments

    • lik_number

      Number of the likelihood for which the Lik object is created.

      • type: int

      • default: 0

    • output_folder

      Folder where the output Lik object is saved. If specified is passed as input to the Lik object, otherwise the Histfactory.output_folder is passed and the Lik object is saved in the same folder as the Histfactory object.

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • verbose

      See verbose.

  • Returns

    Lik object.

  • Creates files

    • Lik.output_h5_file

    • Lik.output_json_file

    • Lik.output_log_file

  • Updates file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.import_likelihoods(lik_list=None, progressbar=True, verbose=None)[source]Â¶

Imports the likelihoods lik_list (if the argument is None it imports all available likelihoods) adding to the corresponding item in the Histfactory.likelihoods_dict dictionary the items corresponding to the keys

  • âmodelâ

  • âobs_dataâ

  • âpars_centralâ

  • âpars_boundsâ

  • âpars_labelsâ

  • âpars_pos_poiâ

  • âpars_pos_nuisâ

and changing the value of the item corresponding to the key âmodel_loadedâ to True. If this value was already True the likelihood is not re-imported. When using interactive python in Jupyter notebooks if progressbar = True the import process shows a progress bar through the ipywidgets module.

  • Arguments

    • lik_list

      List of likelihoods numbers (keys of the Histfactory.likelihoods_dict dictionary) to import. The dictionary items corresponding to the keys lik_list are changed while all others are left unchanged. This allows to only quickly import some likelihoods corresponding to interesting regions of the parameter space without having to import all likelihoods in the workspace. If lik_list = None all available likelihoods are imported.

      • type: list or None

      • default: None

    • progressbar

      If True and if the length of lik_list is bigger than one, then a progress bar is shown.

      • type: bool

      • default: True

    • verbose

      See verbose.

  • Updates file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.save(lik_list=None, timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]Â¶

Saves the Histfactory object by calling the following three methods:

  • Histfactory.save_json

  • Histfactory.save_h5

  • Histfactory.save_log

The Histfactory object is saved to three files: an HDF5 compressed file used to import back the object, a human-readable json file including json serializable attributes, and a log file including the content of the Histfactory.log attribute.

  • Arguments

    Same arguments as the called methods.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Histfactory.output_h5_file

    • Histfactory.output_json_file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.save_h5(lik_list=None, timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]Â¶

Saves the Histfactory object to the HDF5 file Histfactory.output_h5_file. The object is saved by storing the content of the :attr: Histfactory.__dict__ <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.__dict__> attribute in a .h5 file using the deepdish package. The following attributes are excluded from the saved dictionary:

  • Histfactory.input_file

  • Histfactory.input_folder

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

  • Histfactory.output_folder

  • Histfactory.output_h5_file

  • Histfactory.output_json_file

  • Histfactory.output_log_file

  • Histfactory.workspace_folder

  • Histfactory.log (saved to the file Histfactory.output_log_file)

  • Histfactory.verbose

In order to save space, in the :attr:Histfactory.likelihoods_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihoods_dict> the members corresponding to the keys lik_list and that have been imported are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=True mode, while the others are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=False``mode. See the documentation of :attr:``Histfactory.likelihoods_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihoods_dict> for more details.

  • Arguments

    • lik_list

      List of likelihoods numbers (keys of the :attr:Histfactory.likelihoods_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihoods_dict> dictionary) that are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=True âmodeâ. The default value None implies that all members are saved with all available information.

      • type: list or None

      • default: None

    • timestamp

      See timestamp.

    • overwrite

      See overwrite.

    • verbose

      See verbose.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Histfactory.output_h5_file

Histfactory.save_json(lik_list=None, timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]Â¶

Part of the Histfactory object is also saved to the human readable json file Histfactory.output_json_file.

The object is saved by storing all json serializable attributes obtained from the :attr: Histfactory.__dict__ <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.__dict__> attribute. The following attributes are excluded from the saved dictionary:

  • Histfactory.input_file

  • Histfactory.input_folder

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

  • Histfactory.output_folder

  • Histfactory.output_h5_file

  • Histfactory.output_json_file

  • Histfactory.output_log_file

  • Histfactory.workspace_folder

  • Histfactory.log (saved to the file Histfactory.output_log_file)

  • Histfactory.verbose

In order to save space, in the :attr:Histfactory.likelihoods_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihoods_dict> the members corresponding to the keys lik_list and that have been imported are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=True âmodeâ, while the others are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=Falseâmodeâ. The likelihoods_dict["model"] item of the :attr:Histfactory.likelihoods_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihoods_dict> attribute is not saved, since it is not a json serializable object. See the documentation of :attr:Histfactory.likelihoods_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihoods_dict> for more details.

  • Arguments

    Same arguments of the Histfactory.save_h5 method.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Histfactory.output_json_file

Histfactory.save_log(timestamp=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]Â¶

Saves the content of the Histfactory.log attribute in the file Histfactory.output_log_file

This method is called by the methods

  • Histfactory.__init__ (with overwrite=True)

  • Histfactory.get_likelihood_object (with overwrite=True)

  • Histfactory.import_likelihoods (with overwrite=True)

  • Histfactory.save

  • Arguments

    • timestamp

      See timestamp.

    • overwrite

      See overwrite.

    • verbose

      See verbose.

  • Creates/updates file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.set_verbosity()Â¶

Method inherited from the Verbosity object. See the documentation of Verbosity.set_verbosity.
